metadata.title: CVE-2017-18258 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The xz_head function in xzlib.c in libxml2 before 2.9.6 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a craftedLZMA file, because the decoder functionality does not restrict memory usageto what is required for a legitimate file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18258` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.6
libxml2-utils - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.6
python-libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.6').
